Message.Title: Enterprise Value and PE
Message.Msg: Current enterprise value is 52.01B with 5.36 billion shares outstanding. So the market is awarding Cisco's business a price of 9.70 per share. This for a company with $1.83 in trailing earnings, expected to grow over the next twelve months, 46 billion dollars in revenue, and 2% dividend yield. So the real PE is 5.3 against trailing earnings and 5.07 against next year's earnings estimate. I like the odds here.

Topic.Title: I voted for Obama in 2008, and will do so again in 2012

Message.Msg: Buddy, you'll be voting for tax increases on every working American not on food stamps or disability. We don't need tax increases, we need tax reform. Tax increases at this stage will only serve to put more people in unemployment lines. Tax reform will automatically make rich pay more. I don't know why anyone would vote for a jerk who basically lied to young people about having an open administration, cut the budget deficit in half, promised stimulus for infrastructure projects then turn around and give it to his union cronies, green intiative fiascos- then say "oh well", took more vacations and golf outings as President in the history of the US, hired more than 30 czars to run goverment agencies bypassing Congress, a first lady who has 22 assistants ( God knows what for) when every previous first lady had one; turn the White House into a party affair in the first two years while majority of Americans are struggling. Let me see, he didn't really get interested in solving the employment issue until his 4th year because there is an election. Ok let's use rich vs poor angle, rich pay their fair share angle, race card angle: makes me wanna puke cause he's taking you young voters down the same path. We are at a critical junction in US history. If you think Obama with no clue how the economy works (like all politicians who live off the backs of hard working Americans) will take us to the promise land of prosperity- then vote for him. He will take you and your minions for another ride of living like a King off the backs of hard working Americans. This guy will double our national debt in 8 years if re-elected with taxes the likes you have never seen. You're living in a fairy tale if you think the rich are the only ones who will have to pay taxes. Let this sink in- 20% of the top Americans pay around 92% of all federal income taxes. Dude- we're already a welfare state. You better hope Romney wins if we have a snow balls chance of turning the US around by implementing sound policies like tax reform, reduce regulations which choke small/medium business from growing, entitlement reform ( dude ask the government where they put all the social security savings); and last which is what I like - cut out none essential government. We have no money. GET IT! This nation will endure another crisis soon because Obama and his cronies is taking away our one advantage -cheap energy - which is critical for growth. In less than 4 years he is killing the oil drilling industry, putting ridiculous regulation on utilities which will cost you 40-50% more in the next 5 years, growing a bigger government when we have fewer working people which we haven't seen since 1982; more regulations on cars, health insurance, financial industry, epa, chemicals; food, pharmaceuticals. If you vote for this guy again, I can promise more pain and suffering the likes we've never seen as a nation and the sad thing- it will be irreversable.

Message.Title: Cisco's see improvement in cusotmer reaction: See Chambers comment to Fox Business Network.
Message.Msg: Cisco's Chambers: Recent Layoff Was 'About Moving Resources Around' -Fox Business Cisco Systems Inc. (CSCO) chief executive John Chambers, when asked on Monday about the possibility of more layoffs, told Fox Business Network that it is "actually a little bit the reverse." The networking equipment company last week announced it was shedding 1,300 jobs, or 2% of its work force, in what Mr. Chambers said today was "about moving resources around, about positioning ourselves where the industry needs to go." Mr. Chambers, speaking from the Olympic Games in London, said the company doesn't worry about competitors in China or the U.S. Cisco's customers have said there is now more balance and consistency in the U.S. economy, Chambers told Fox Business Network. When asked how the U.S. can encourage growth, Mr. Chambers mentioned Canada's education, immigration and entrepreneurial systems and said the U.K. has a pro-jobs and pro-business environment. "We are going to bet big on the U.K.," Mr. Chambers said.

Message.Title: CSCO growing rapidly
Message.Msg: Chambers said today Cisco is growing in key areas: "We never gained more market share than we did this last year, in routing, we gained seven points, in switching we're back to 70 percent share, and in video we lead the way, but at times you have your resources in the wrong place. That’s really what this recent change was."
